content: there's an instance I'm trying to use called finite.set.finite_inter_of_right and I cant seem to get it even after importing data.set.finite. am I just not importing the right thing?
by "there" do you mean in your local install or in the online docs? The former might be out of date
I found it in the online docs, yup
I don't know how to go about updating the library but I only started using lean earlier this month and I can't imagine that something this simple would be added this late

Mathlib gets rearranged and reorganized a lot, so its quite possible something this basic was renamed recently, or that it was refactored to look this way only recently. Are you working on a copy of mathlib, or as a dependency in another project?
I'm not completely sure what you mean but I just followed the installation instructions online since early september and have been using whatever copy of mathlib was installed at the time since then
I'll look into updating mathlib and see if that helps
actually, even better: I found the actual lemma that I wanted haha woops
King Arthur has marked this topic as resolved.
